name: The Castle Country House

reviews.text: My aunt, husband & I spent 3 nights with the Nugents, and thoroughly enjoyed their hospitality, accommodations & food. All were wonderful. I made the mistake of getting directions off Google, which directed us onto the R672. We were completely lost, but were giving it one more shot, still having to stop to ask at a farmhouse if we were even close. Emma, Gus, Lucy & Kate came flying up the lane to our rescue. The house is easy to find if you're on the right road - the R671. Just turn east in Millhouse. Hopefully we'll have the chance to stay here again. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in late July, had the fabulous bedroom at the front. Friendly family, gorgeous grounds and amazing breakfasts!
reviews.title: Slice of paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Joan and her family could not have been more welcoming, helpful and friendly. There is a great family feel to the place. This is a quirky B&B. The house is a little old-fashioned, with lots of antiques, books, paintings and knicknacks. Our room had lovely views over the garden, but was small and so was the ensuite shower room. If you are hoping for the bathroom in the photo on the website, you should probably request it when booking. The breakfast was delicious. Lots of homemade compotes - the rhubarb and ginger was fantastic with the porridge.
reviews.title: Very friendly hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Nugent family makes you one of them...from the moment they greet you at the door until you leave. This wonderful country house has all the amenities one could ask for and more. An added feature for us was to have one of the Nugent grandchildren as our guide to explore the garden and river area; don't miss walking the property. The breakfasts provided are lovingly made by the Nugents, from the traditional Irish breakfast to fresh fruit and homebaked bread; ask for the porridge with fresh fruit (wonderful).
reviews.title: We are ready to move in!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed her with our respective parents on our way to West Cork. We all loved this place - it really is as good as all the other reviews say.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good quality accommodation and Joan and her family are extremely hospitable, making for a very pleasant stay. A cup of tea and (big) piece of pie on arrival shows the kind of treatment you can expect during your time here. Had a choice of rooms all of which looked inviting. The room we had was clean, comfortable and well-furnished. Breakfast is enormous; the porridge and fresh fruit fills you up before you even begin on the full Irish. I guess you could always say `no`, but that would be rude :)
reviews.title: The warmest of welcomes

reviews.text: If you can, make this your last stop. As we discovered, you`ll find nowhere else feels the same.
reviews.title: One of the highlights of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a lovely B & B. My daughter and I stayed for two nights at the beginning of August 2012. From the moment we arrived we were made to special. The whole family was very warm and welcoming. The room that we stayed in was part of the original castle and was very large with a great view. The bed was beyond comfortable. Each morning we were treated to a wonderful full Irish breakfast. Joan's preserves and homemade porridge are out of this world!
reviews.title: Best B&B
Best room and best breakfast of the trip
reviews.text: The grounds are lovely and worth the stroll around.
I would definitely recommend this B & B to anyone.
reviews.title: Peaceful, comfortable b&b

reviews.text: We are a family of 6 (4 children) and we loved Castle Country House. They received us with such warmth and really made us feel at home. The breakfast was UNBELIEVABLE!!! So fresh and good quality. We were in Ireland for 6 days and only slept in BB but this one was by far the best! We do recommend it to all!
reviews.title: Amazing!!!
"Just lovely" as the Irish would say!
reviews.text: Joan was a "perfect" hostess; the rooms, beds and breakfast were outstanding. Please note that it is out in the countryside, and the shower stalls are a wee bit small.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this little piece of heaven online and have never looked back, what a treasure to find, we have stayed here on numerous occasions. Joan, the lady of the house makes you feel like you are part of the family from the moment she opens the door, after a long trip from Dublin, climbing into one of her beautiful luxury beds is like heaven on earth. Her beautiful house has alot of history and around every corner it bellows a warm welcome and beautiful interior. Each room has its own name and design, one feels like you have stepped back in time for a moment to proper hospitality the way it should be. On waking each morning, you are greeted with an Irish breakfast that is made to your taste, beautiful organic menu full of produce from Ireland and the family farm, to tempt the taste buds. Joan herself will sit down for a chat, and on arriving back home in the evening you are greeted with a warm cup of tea and what ever yummy treats she has freshly cooked that day. The surrounding gardens have a wild character and one can stroll down to the river, sit in the warm sunshine and switch off. After returning to normal life, we certainly felt relaxed and spoiled. I would highly recommend a visit to experience the full Irish welcome. We will be back for sure.
reviews.title: PERFECT, SWITCH OFF, RELAX AND UNWIND

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful stay we had with Joan and Emmett. We were made to feel so welcome, we wish we were able to stay much longer than one night. The house was fantastic, we had a great sleep in a very comfortable quiet room. Joans homemade applepie & coffee on arrival was very much appreciated. The breakfast was out of this world. We would highly recommend The Castle Country House.
reviews.title: All the reviews on trip advisor are right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had the absolute pleasure of staying with Joan last week for 3 wonderful nights. We had travelled Ireland for two weeks staying in a variety of accommodation and thought we had experienced some good accommodation. However, none came any where near to the quality of both accommodation and the true Irish hospitality as we experienced with Joan. From the moment we arrived (a cup of tea and scones) we new this was going to be something special. We were welcomed as though we had been friends for many years and after staying for three nights we left feeling as part of her family. Joan and her wonderful family are truly special people who love what they are doing. The rooms were wonderful, the meals were exquisite and the warmth in her hospitality made us feel like we were at home. The location although being out of town should not put you off as it is an easy drive from many lovely area's including Cork, Waterford and all the surrounding area's. Treat yourself to something special and visit Joan for a few nights.
reviews.title: Absolute a must to experience Ireland hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked for 2 nights after reading earlier reviews and was not disappointed. What a wonderful place to stay and what a lovely warm family! We stayed in Lady Mary's room (comprising the original 16th century tower house) and my goodness, the bed alone was worth trip - its so comfy and huge. The room was elegantly decorated, scrupulously clean, bright and airy. We were given tea on arrival (we had to refuse the cake as we were on way back to Dungarvan for wedding reception) and Mrs Nugent even offered to collect us later that night!
reviews.title: Warm & welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a wonderful night's sleep we were treated to the breakfast speciality - porridge with fruits from the garden. I didn't think porridge could be that good. Two bowls later we tucked into an Irish fry (all locally sourced) which did us until late afternoon.
reviews.title: Just like home!

reviews.text: It may at first seems out of the way but Google directions are spot on (we found it no problem at 1am after the wedding) and to be honest why stay in a town when you can wake up to rolling green hills? I am recommending the Castle Country House to all family and friends and can't wait to go back again but this time with my young son and for longer. The Nugent family made us feel very welcomed. Lovely place, lovely people - what more can I say.
reviews.title: Like Coming Home while still on Holiday

reviews.text: This is a smart house set away in Waterford's countryside and owned and run by the Nugent family. The house has historic relevance with anecdotes from the Cromwellian wars and about local local dignitaries playing a part in its 400 year story. On arrival we were met by Joan complete with warm handshake, hot tea and a slice of pie! This was followed by a tour around the house and being shown to our room with all the charm of a stately manor.
reviews.title: Welcomed like family

reviews.text: Later we met Emmett, certainly a character and as a pair Joan and Emmett make great hosts, they are helped by two lovely daughters and the rest of the family are always about as the house is part of a working dairy farm. Now, as with all farms, and as other reviewers have said the breakfast is amazing! To quote Joan and her fabulous fruit filled (grown in the garden) porridge, "you must go back and back and back until its all gone!!" If I had done that, and it was tempting I wouldn't have had a chance to sample the other breakfast delights, such as the smoked salmon and scrambled eggs, or the full Irish breakfast, again all locally sourced. This really set you up for the days events to follow.
reviews.title: Wow! Stay here if you're anywhere near Dungarvan

description: The Castle Country House has evolved from a 15th century Norman castle. Later it was expanding and became the manor house of the O'Keeffe family. It is a unique property that has been lovingly restored and now provides luxurious accommodation in a beautiful riverside location.Breakfast, using home grown and local produce, is served each morning in the original castle dining room and every effort is made to ensure that our guests enjoy a memorable and relaxing stay.
